article_summary:
"Staff engagement is a function of good management and teamwork, staff satisfaction and staff health and wellbeing.
Staff wellbeing, for example, is an important antecedent of patient care performance," authors write in the report.
To learn more:- here's the report (.pdf)Related Articles:Better patient satisfaction comes from hospital staffNew study shows why words matter--and can help improve patient experience4 strategies to employee engagementValue employees for better hospital performance, engagement
How healthcare staff feel about their work can affect a hospital's efficiency and financial performance, according to the report.
Healthcare providers must encourage employee engagement if they want to improve patient care, according to a new report from the Point of Care Foundation in the United Kingdom.
